page.title: 19ALL SAINT'S CHURCH OCKBROOK
page.content: The varying materials used in the construction of All Saint's church make it a most interesting building. The original building,chancel,nave and western tower,are of very old stone.The spire which was restored in 1894 is a low octagonal one.About 1815, a North aisle was built from red brick.Stone blocks were used to build the south aisle in 1835.The Norman font which was re-installed in 1963 indicates that there was a church on this site as early as the 11th century.The choir has a very strong influence on the life of the church.At its peak membership numbered 46 ,with a waiting list, lady members being most numerous.
